creator: boris.lauser@fao.org
text:
Hi Boris Lauser,

Thank you for reporting this issue.

This failure appears to arise from the Crimson XML perser.  Could you ask the 
Apache Community (http://xml.apache.org/ and 
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/) to investigate this issue further, please?  
The Crimson developers should be able to provide faster and more appropriate 
service.

Regards,
Jonathan
----------------- Original Bug Report-------------------

category : java
release : 1.4
subcategory : accessibility
type : bug
synopsis : org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Document root element is missing 
description : FULL PRODUCT VERSION : java version "1.4.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.0-b92) Java HotSpot
(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.0-b92, mixed mode)

FULL OPERATING SYSTEM VERSION :Microsoft Windows 2000
[Version 5.00.2195]

A DESCRIPTION OF THE PROBLEM :
According to the sun website info, the xml parser, that
comes with it should support UTF-8 encoded files. However, there is a problem 
with UTF-8 Files, which are saved with Mirosoft Notepad 2000. When the file is 
saved with that it writes a 3 byte BOM (byte order mark) at the beginning of 
the file. When I try to parse the file with the parser, it gives and error and 
does not parse anything at all. The error it gives is the
following:


Exception in thread "main"
org.w3c.rdf.model.ModelException: Error parsing RDF X
ML data.
        at org.w3c.rdf.implementation.RDFFactoryImpl.openModel(Unknown
Source)
        at org.w3c.rdf.util.RDFManager.openModel(Unknown
Source)
        at test.Load.main(Load.java:19)
Caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Document root
element is missing.
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal
(Parser2.java:3182)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal
(Parser2.java:3170)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseInternal
(Parser2.java:501)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parse
(Parser2.java:305)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse
(XMLReaderImpl.java:442)

        at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse
(SAXParser.java:345)
        at org.w3c.rdf.implementation.syntax.RDFParserImpl.parse
(Unknown Source)

        ... 3 more


 However, when I manually read in the saved file bytewise
and output it again bytewise (without the first 3 bytes),
the parsing works fine.

STEPS TO FOLLOW TO REPRODUCE THE PROBLEM :
1. Save any xml/rdf file as UTF-8 (not ASCII) in Win2000 Notepad 2. Try to 
parse it with the xml parser 3.

EXPECTED VERSUS ACTUAL BEHAVIOR :
Should parse without problems

Instead it gives the above described error

ERROR MESSAGES/STACK TRACES THAT OCCUR :
Exception in thread "main" org.w3c.rdf.model.ModelException: Error parsing RDF 
X ML data.
        at org.w3c.rdf.implementation.RDFFactoryImpl.openModel(Unknown Source)
        at org.w3c.rdf.util.RDFManager.openModel(Unknown Source)
        at test.Load.main(Load.java:19)
Caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Document root element is missing.
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3182)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3170)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseInternal(Parser2.java:501)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parse(Parser2.java:305)
        at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse(XMLReaderImpl.java:442)

        at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:345)
        at org.w3c.rdf.implementation.syntax.RDFParserImpl.parse(Unknown Source)

        ... 3 more


This bug can be reproduced always.

CUSTOMER WORKAROUND :
After saving it, read in the UTF-8 XML Dok again with a ByteReader and bytewise 
write the file again to the disk, BUT without the leading 3 Bytes. workaround :
